page.title: 09The Secondary School -Kirton
page.content: The secondary school was built in 1958 and accommodates approximately 540 children. In 1985 there are 303 boys and 243 girls. The largest classes have 32 children and the smallest have 15. Approximately 200 children come in by bus from the surrounding villages. Wyberton, Kirton End, Hubberts Bridge, Amber Hill and Holland Fen. There are two double decker buses and three coaches, which arrive between 8.20 a.m. and 8.45 a.m. The headmaster's name is John Pegler and he began in January 1976 and is retiring in July 1985. The staff have a complement of 30 full time teachers and 1 part-time teacher. There is one secretary but no ancillary helpers.
